website_summaries.verdict: If you don't mind the shorter display life of dye-based prints or the paper choices offered by Canon, the Pixma Pro9000 makes an excellent choice for a medium-format inkjet printer.
pros: accepts paper sizes up to 13x19 inches
can clean nozzles for subset of colors
cons: Dye prints don't last as long as those made with pigment inks

customer_reviews.title: Still working after all these years
customer_reviews.text: It's New Years Eve and I'm reviewing my Amazon purchase history. I'm surprised to see that This printer was purchased nine years ago and still makes very good photo prints. It shows that the Canon printer was well made and has stood up to several operating system upgrades. There are certainly new printers that would be a better current choice, but I'm amazed this held up so long. I did use only Canon cartridges and kept things clean.
customer_reviews.author: Seattle Sue

customer_reviews.title: will not work with UNIX
customer_reviews.text: I own two printers. One for day-to-day printing including duplex, and this Canon, for large format and higher-quality prints. The speed of the Canon is irrelevant to my applications. I am pleased with the Canon printer itself; however, it is only because of it, and my Canon 9950f scanner (another pleasing piece of hardware), that I have had to keep a Windows machine around and not go over completely to Ubuntu Linux (a UNIX like operating system) because there are no drivers available for either in UNIX. When a driver is available for UNIX-like operating systems, I will gladly bump up my ratings to five stars.
customer_reviews.author: J. R. Lee

customer_reviews.title: A Printer You Gotta Have
customer_reviews.text: Unpack, assemble following the quick start guide, and print pictures that will blow you away. I had an HP photoprinter and was pretty happy, Then it started to give me a few problems. I could not resolve them and had started looking for a printer that would produce pictures that were worthy of my NIKON D-200. This printer MOOORRRREEEE than met my expectations. I think you would be very happy putting this in your office to print your favorite pictures. Make sure you have a LARGE space to put it. The footprint is VERY LARGE. You will need a 30" X 30" space to park it.
customer_reviews.author: Bobby F. Moulden

customer_reviews.title: I finally swtiched to Cannon & wonder why I waited so long
customer_reviews.text: I'm as happy as a clam with the Cannon Pro9000 printer, all of my jobs went through smoothly and printed nicely, even on textured specialty construction paper, imagine that. I swtiched from HP for my home office needs, and cannot believe that I didn't own a Cannon sooner. Recently I'm branching out into graphic design and many reviews pointed to the Cannon, and it seems with good reason. I have not yet experimented with all the features or print capabilities, but so far I'm highly impressed and look forward to many fine projects. Well worth the money!
customer_reviews.author: Shauna007

customer_reviews.title: Gorgeous prints, but a bit difficult to use and get set up
customer_reviews.text: I am a graphic designer and can honestly say that the prints are absolutely gorgeous! However, that being said, the printer was difficult to set up and instructions that came with the printer were inadequate. It took me over two hours to get it going. Too bad it's not network ready. Again, the print quality is absolutely phenomenal and if you don't mind spending a little time getting to know the printer and setting it up, it's a great machine that is meant for the graphic arts.
customer_reviews.author: CreativeZoo

customer_reviews.title: Gorgous Prints
customer_reviews.text: When I purchased This printer a month ago it was a toss up between this one,the canon 9000 pro and the Epson 2400, I have always been a big canon supporter because of quality for the price,and this printer does not disappoint the prints that this printer did,off of my canon 40d and on 13x19 canon proII photo paper was really gorgous.I don't feel anyone could go wrong with this printer if you would like to do your own enlargements.And it does it fast and quiet!!!I do wish that they made the canon proII paper in 11x14 Glenn Yearout
customer_reviews.author: Glenn A. Yearout

customer_reviews.title: canon pixma pro9000
customer_reviews.text: This came down for me to either the epson or canon. Since I already have an epson I thought I'd try the canon. I never looked back. This printer is amazing. It starts fast and prints spectacular prints on gloss, but not so great on matte. It uses alot of two out of eight ink, but that's a minor quip. I've never had a stopped up nozzle like the epson. I highly recommend this.
customer_reviews.author: Dr.Savage

customer_reviews.title: Mine doesn't work
customer_reviews.text: I bought the Pixma Pro 9000 about a year & a half ago and it worked great for about 6 months and then the feed quit working. Prints looked great when it was working and I used Canon & Ilford Gloss & Semi-gloss (pearl) paper. Wish it was still working and I am too busy to haul it in to get looked at, so it sits unused and non-functional. Bummer, Carlton
customer_reviews.author: Carlton Ward

customer_reviews.title: Astounding print quality, sometimes struggles with paper handling.
customer_reviews.text: Big machine, very happy with print quality, and there are tons of print options to adjust. Seems a little balky handling some types of papers, and I occasionally have to "help" the paper get pulled in. I use top quality papers, too. So far, have only printed on premium glossy, and am curious on how it will look printing on ultra-expensive art papers. Overall, very satisfied.
customer_reviews.author: emmenar2

customer_reviews.title: Canon pro9000
customer_reviews.text: Wow! I have owned both HP and Epson printers for my digital pictures. Those printers do not compare to this BIG DAWG! yes, it's big takes a lot of space. I Love this printer, it works great, either directly from my canon rebel xti or from the computer running vista. Small or big prints this is a printer for the serious hobby photographer or the professional just getting out. Sets up easy. I have a closet of printers anyone interested, good price. haha. Thanks Amazon for a great price. No one could touch it!
customer_reviews.author: J. Cart

customer_reviews.title: Beautiful Prints
customer_reviews.text: This printer replaced my Canon i9900 that developed trouble after about three years (and heavy use). The old printer was very, very good, the new one is better! With care and a lot of work this printer can do better than any lab I have ever worked with, and that's saying a lot! It's not less expensive than a lab, and certainly not less work, but better.
customer_reviews.author: boB

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma Pro9000
customer_reviews.text: I love my printer. It takes all kinds of paper. I have even printed on glittered covered cards for my daughters' birthday party and not one paper jam. It is quite large. It sits on our two drawer file cabnet and takes up all the room. It is a bit loud, but that is not an issue with me. I love the quality prints it makes. I am an advid scrapbooker.
customer_reviews.author: T. Walter

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for the money!
customer_reviews.text: This is a great printer! Prints lovely quality photos, but the ink seems to run out pretty fast. I buy the aftermarket replacement cartridges that cost a lot less then the factory ones, and they work just as well.
customer_reviews.author: SB

customer_reviews.title: Excellent printer
customer_reviews.text: Excellent printer used for a for a wide range of projects, provides excellent photo printing as well as post cards and just ordinary printing. Ink can be expensive if using the Canon OEM cartridges, especially since there are eight of them and they aren't very big. With a little bit of effort, you can easily refill the cartridges yourself and even buy a chip resetter to reset the ink tracking feature. I've used an eBay store called Hobbicolors for the bulk ink and had great results and great prices for the bulk ink.
customer_reviews.author: D. Swanson

customer_reviews.title: A Great Printer!
customer_reviews.text: I have had mine for 3 weeks now and have printed about 50 8x10s. The quality is top notch. Set up is easy, printer software is solid, it is reasonably fast, reasonably easy on ink use, and the output is wonderful. I traded up from an Epson 890 and am so happy that I did. No more clogged Epson jets, a common and annoying event.
customer_reviews.author: Anthony M. Zipple

customer_reviews.title: Would buy another in a moment
customer_reviews.text: Unlike other inkjets that dry up if you don't use them at least once a week, this one performs well, even when using non-Canon ink from the get-go. Canon support is great and available even late nites.
customer_reviews.author: Harvey B. Vedder

customer_reviews.title: MissB46
customer_reviews.text: This is just the printer I've been looking for. It is large enough to do my larger photo printing but versatile enough to keep up with my every day correspondence. It you want beautiful photos and crisp professional looking documents then this is your printer. If you are impatient and want speed and don't care about the appearance of your photos and documents then this isn't the printer for you. For the price, it's a great deal.
customer_reviews.author: B. Miller

customer_reviews.title: Positive experience with the Canan Pro-9000 PIXMA
customer_reviews.text: This is a good printer, but the cons are; The ink is expensive and requires two black cartridges, also I find it a little slow and noisy. The pros are; sturdy build, easy to remove paper jams, easy set up and instructions.
customer_reviews.author: Sylvia Brown

customer_reviews.title: You purchased this item on March 28, 2008
customer_reviews.text: Still working flawlessly after all these years, but I only use original ink. Most inkjet problems can be traced to aftermarket ink sets.
customer_reviews.author: Ricardo Nesrala

customer_reviews.title: still have it
customer_reviews.text: Great product- when it's time I'll order a new one
customer_reviews.author: jeff

customer_reviews.title: Awesome prints, great quailty, vivid color!
customer_reviews.text: My first review! Anyway I ordered this printer, set it up in ten mintues, and it is everything I had hoped for and more. I have a Canon Rebel XTi (10.1 mp) and an Olympus 8.1 MP point and shoot. I havee been getting more and more into photography so I wanted a GOOD printer to print my photos with. I have printed some of the larger 13 x 19 pics, and they were flawless. I recommend this one to anyone willing to invest in it.
customer_reviews.author: Ralph W. Racette

customer_reviews.title: Pixma pro 9000 makes exellent photos.
customer_reviews.text: Great photos, inks are in seperate tanks, very good b/w photos, easy to use. reliable...so far. The only thing I would like to see is a system that synchronizes what you see on the monitor with the pics this printer produces. Monitor to printer calibration systems are more costly than the printer itself. Rumor has it that if you wait a year or two, this technology will be incorporated into the next generation of printers. We shall see.
customer_reviews.author: Sharky

customer_reviews.title: Canon Fan
customer_reviews.text: Great printer. I've done some amazing prints. Look very professional.
customer_reviews.author: P. Grabarz

customer_reviews.title: Works as advertised
customer_reviews.text: I printed some 13 x 19 photos to try the maximum size out shortly after I got this, and they were spectacular. Color reproduction is outstanding. The printer was easy to set up, except it's REALLY big - required some rearrangement from the spot where my prior printers were. Reasonably fast on printing in color - also have done some newsletters in black and white and that worked well too. Overall an outstanding printer.
customer_reviews.author: John Miller

customer_reviews.title: Pixma Pro 9000  good value for money
customer_reviews.text: I received the printer, got it out of the box , turned on and set up in less than 20 minutes. I have printed a few 13 X 19 enlargements from my Nikon D300 at fine and they are stunning. Ink set cost $100 but I have no idea yet how long they will last.
customer_reviews.author: Carol Schilansky

customer_reviews.title: 13X19
customer_reviews.text: An outstanding printer. Handles many thicknesses of 13X19 and down and the colors are great. Of course, the ink costs are OUCH but I would still recommend manufactures ink only.
customer_reviews.author: Robert Laffer

customer_reviews.title: Outstanding Pictures!
customer_reviews.text: I never write one of these reviews but felt compelled to write about this printer. I wasn't really in the market for a printer but just got back from a European vacation and had some great pics that I had printed at a photo lab. My friend also printed some of my pics on her printer (an older canon 8500) at home and the difference was VERY noticeable and made me want to do my own printing. So I bought the new Canon 9000 and I was blown away by the picture quality. The prints have more clarity and color balance than those done at the professional lab hands down! I am very pleased and highly recommend this printer.
customer_reviews.author: B. Williams

customer_reviews.title: Lots of space, but great results
customer_reviews.text: The Pixma Pro9000 has one significant disadvantage- it takes an extraordinary amount of space, but that is inherent in a product that produces 13 by 19 images. The images are excellent, even when using Canon Photo Plus paper and not the art paper which can also be utilized.
customer_reviews.author: Long time Mac user

customer_reviews.title: Just What I Needed
customer_reviews.text: Having used the HP 9650 for years, and the previous model before that, I still need the ability to print 11X17 paper. The PIXMA PRO 9000 installed easily, and runs seamlessly. The only issue I have with the product is the default paper and quality is set to Photo and it seems difficult to change it to a lower setting permanently. It wants to do photos, it is made to do photo quality, and it does it well.
customer_reviews.author: T. Marr

customer_reviews.title: Great printer for large photos!
customer_reviews.text: Brand new .... loved output .... nice details! Will update review after I produce more photos. Love that it uses seperate ink tanks! Quick shipper! Plan to use the 13" capacity to make custom cut laser cut puzzles!
customer_reviews.author: Joseph P. Portas

customer_reviews.title: Somethings Wrong
customer_reviews.text: Although the unit appears to work okay...random electronic error messages appear...may indicate something wrong with the circuitry...wouldn't recommend this vendor....still trying to figure out what's going on with this particular unit...my previous version of this printer was fine.
customer_reviews.author: Poet

customer_reviews.title: Great printer on many types of paper
customer_reviews.text: I've had this printer for 6 months. It does a great job. I've printed on glossy, pearl & canvas paper. I've printed from 4x6 to 13x19 without issue. The front loader for the thicker canvas works well as long as you follow the instructions. Very satisfied customer.
customer_reviews.author: Photo buff

customer_reviews.title: Excellent quality, easy to use.
customer_reviews.text: While we have only had this printer for less than 2 months, the setup was very easy, and we made some very good quality prints. The software includes and "easy" print method to make sure you get the quality and size you need. It is better than the Photo Print wizard that comes with Windows XP. The only down side to this printer is the 8 different colors of ink cartridges you need, but I will take the quality I have seen over the inconvenience.
customer_reviews.author: N Wagner

customer_reviews.title: Canon PIXMA Pro9000 Photo Printer
customer_reviews.text: Wow! Having used an HP Photosmart printer for a while I thought I had seen great prints. Then I got this printer. What a world of difference! I tried 13x19" prints and was amazed at the quality of the prints. A highly recommended printer for serious photo printing.
customer_reviews.author: Rodney G. Lamping

customer_reviews.title: BEST printer EVER!
customer_reviews.text: I have owned MANY different printers, and I have to say this is the best one i have ever owned. Why did it take me so long to try a Canon? I will never go back to any other brand!
customer_reviews.author: Eric

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma Pro9000
customer_reviews.text: So far I am very happy with this purchase. It set-up with ease. I didn't have any problems setting it up with the Vista OS. Color prints took a little bit of fine tuning to get the results I was looking for but now prints are great. Black and white prints look great. Especially on Ilfords new Silk Gallerie paper.
customer_reviews.author: W. Zuback

customer_reviews.title: Great printer, watch the ink.
customer_reviews.text: I love the printer, my one complaint is ink usage. I print only documents (black Ink only) but the printer empties the color cartridges during the cleaning cycles. It empties the color cartridges that I don't use practically as fast as the black that I do use.
customer_reviews.author: R. G.

customer_reviews.title: You won't be disappointed
customer_reviews.text: I was looking to up-grade my photographic printer and researched The Pro 9000. This printer does a fantastic job, consumes less ink than comparable Epsom printers, and has exceeded my expectations on print quality. Well worth the money if you are serious about your printed images and do not want to keep going to a lab to print your work
customer_reviews.author: Frank P. Ficalora

customer_reviews.title: amazing printer
customer_reviews.text: After I set it up, I took a test shot and the result was better than expected. Very professional. Love it.
customer_reviews.author: M. Brown

customer_reviews.title: Pro9000 Printer
customer_reviews.text: This is the best printer I have ever owned. The colors print true with the included software plugin for PS CS3.
customer_reviews.author: Amazon Customer

customer_reviews.title: Canon Pixma Pro9000 Printer
customer_reviews.text: The printer was priced right, shipped quick, got here in one piece and worked perfectly right out of the box. What more could you ask for?
customer_reviews.author: Thomas Moores

customer_reviews.title: never worked well
customer_reviews.text: I did not have time to figure this out and it never worked well. I gave it away and would never buy another Cannon because of this.
customer_reviews.author: Leenie

customer_reviews.title: Better than commercial printers!
customer_reviews.text: Got this last week and it's tremendous! I'm printing on Canon Pro and Plus papers, as well as Ilford gallerie papers. They're all breathtaking. My friends and family think they're professionally printed. I'm really happy with it. Had a Canon pixma i6600. Not even in the same category. I'm so glad I upgraded. Will print up to 13x19. It's fast too! But it is gigantic!!! I absolutely highly recommend it!
customer_reviews.author: Jayna Wondertwin

customer_reviews.title: WOW
customer_reviews.text: The color from this printer just blew me away. Canon is still tops in printers.
customer_reviews.author: T. Prince

customer_reviews.title: happy with it.
customer_reviews.text: I got it delivered today, 7 days earlier than it was expected. It came with 8 color-inks so I was happy to use it right away after the installation. It is much bigger than my Epson Artisan but it looks nice on my desk.
customer_reviews.author: kc

customer_reviews.title: defective
customer_reviews.text: Printer arrived defective, lacked cartridges, power card, the card is not sold in the dominican republic, I pay a lot of money for shiping in Santo Domingo around us170.00 dollars and would be very expensive to return the printer
customer_reviews.author: Cristhian Garcia

customer_reviews.title: Piece of Junk
customer_reviews.text: This printer has never worked for me. 70% of the time it eats the paper. With 11x17, 100% of the time is miss aligns the sheet. This printer has been an expensive headache. Next time, I will make sure to buy my computer equipment from a local store. Ordering from Amazon does not give you the opportunity to take it back if your item turns out to be a piece of junk like this.
customer_reviews.author: Maddy Prosser

customer_reviews.title: Get the Big Picture
customer_reviews.text: Very high quality pictures, Have used it to print pictures from 4X6 to 13X19.
customer_reviews.author: Big Al

customer_reviews.title: worked for a minute
customer_reviews.text: now it leaves banding lines and a deep dark run at the end of the page
customer_reviews.author: Gerard L. Livernois

customer_reviews.title: Good print quality and support
customer_reviews.text: I had trouble setting up the printer and not paying attention to detail in the Getting Started manual. If you take your time and literally follow the steps it will install without any problems. But, if you are bullheaded and need support like me, Canon was quite responsive in guiding success. I have printed several photos that have been snatched up readily by my fans. They are urging me to turn pro. It's embarrassing -- because I have a lot to learn about the power and options this printer will produce.
customer_reviews.author: Al Bledsoe

customer_reviews.title: Still waiting for delivery after one month
customer_reviews.text: The printer may be the best thing since sliced bread, but I would't know because to the best of my knowledge it has not yet been delivered to the shipping address specified in the order.
customer_reviews.author: Don Mckell

product_meta.title: U) CANON PRO 9000 PHOTO PRINTER
product_meta.description: Canon Pixma Pro9000 Professional Large Format Inkjet Printer
feature_bullets: Maximum 4800 x 2400 dpi FINE print head technology
Support for fine art paper up to 13" x 19" with two separate paper paths, including front feeder for heavyweight paper types
Professional printer features using Easy-PhotoPrint Pro (Plug-in software for Adobe Photoshop CS/CS2)and (CS3 and CS3 Extended.
New printer driver with advanced color controls

specifications.Customer Reviews: 3.7 out of 5 stars179 ratings3.7 out of 5 stars
